meanings.definition: A person regarded as clumsy, stupid, or unattractive.
meanings.sent1: The schlub tripped over his own shoelaces.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a schlub and forget your umbrella on a rainy day.
meanings.sent3: The schlub tried to impress everyone with his dance moves but ended up knocking over a plant.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a schlub compared to the elegant guests at the party.
meanings.sent5: The image of the schlub with mismatched socks stuck in everyone's mind.

meanings.definition: To behave in a clumsy or unattractive manner.
meanings.sent1: Please don't schlub around the house and break anything.
meanings.sent2: She tends to schlub when she's nervous, dropping things left and right.
meanings.sent3: He schlubbed his way through the obstacle course, much to the amusement of the spectators.
meanings.sent4: The car schlubbed along the bumpy road, making strange noises.
meanings.sent5: The toddler tried to schlub his way into the cookie jar, but his mom caught him in the act.
